column4: Cand the compiz-fision effects be used while using dual monitors (twinview) ?
Basically it depends on what graphics card you're using, what driver, and the combined resolution of both monitors.
What is the total virtual display area for both your monitors?
nvidia 7 series on a Acer aspire 5630 lcd is 1280x800 and external lcd panel is 1280x1024
as for total virtual area, I'm not sure, how can I tell ?
At least you have nvidia on your side.  I'm not as familiar with nvidia as I am with ATI, but it should be possible.  Total virtual area = (x resolution + x resolution)x(y resolution + y resolution)
just to be clear, if I disable the extended monitor, the effects etc all work fine so the nividia driver and all that seems to work fine
Well that's a good sign.  Do you have dual monitors working WITHOUT compiz at all?
yes sort off, although it is difficult to get the resolutions set correctly for both simultaneously... i.e. either external is correct or laptop iis correct

Yeah, I luckily haven't had to deal with two different resolution monitors, both of mine are same resolution.  I've heard that when you do get it working, the smaller resolution one actually scrolls around, so the resolution is actually the same for each monitor, but because the viewport is smaller on one of them, when you move the mouse around, the viewport of the smaller monitor 'scrolls' around.  Anyway, to answer yo
any chance you can help with my other problem regarding "Authentication failure" while trying to upgrade another machine to Gutsy ?

yes I understand, although my problem  seems the other way around i.e. the higher capability scrolls around if the lower laptop one is set right or if the higher capable monitor is set correctly then the laptop seems to step down in rez and not pan around

Huh, that's odd.  Unfortunately, as I said, I'm no nvidia master, I've got an ATI myself (pronounced 'masochist' when running linux....) so I'm not familiar with the TwinView options.  And I'm pretty sure MergedFB is strictly an ATI thing.  So can't help you there, boss, sorry!
so any suggestions regarding getting compiz going with both monitors
Authentication Failure, eh?  I work in tech support, and my first response to authentication failure is: "Do you have caps lock or num lock on, sir?" ;-)
hehe.. ok thanks for your time anyway
No problem, sorry I couldn't help.
